title: Update: Verify user's settings are kept intact when updating to new version

title: Verify selecting Continue Watching opens the Continue Watching  Page
custom_preconds: Valid WWE subscriber account signed in.
custom_steps:
1. go to MY ACCOUNT
2. select CONTINUE WATCHING button
custom_expected:
App jumps to CONTINUE WATCHING list page.

a. If no videos have been watched and bookmarked before the end of content; the text, "No items yet" displays
b. If one or more videos have been bookmarked, a scrolling list displays. For each bookmarked item, the following displays (if available from data): Thumbnail image, progress bar, Show Title, Epiosode Name, Air Date, and brief description.

title: Continue Watching: Verify launching a VOD and exiting playback before the end adds the content to the Continue Watching List
custom_preconds: Only video launched as VOD should create bookmarks to resume at a later time. To verify this is working as expected, launching from Shows lists, Schedule, Home screen and any video launched from Search (milestones).
custom_steps:
1. Go to Shows and select:
a. PPV > WWE, WWE (alt. audio), ECW or WCW > (select a year if applicable)
b. In- Ring
c. Originals
d. Collections
e. Vault
2. Select a show that has not been viewed before and Select PLAY
3. Video launches (preroll and bumpers play); let playback continue for at least 15 seconds
4. Back out of video
5. Confirm Show launch screen displays Progress bar representative of amount watched and that RESUME button replaces PLAY
6. Note the show and progress
7. Go to MY ACCOUNT and select CONTINUE WATCHING
custom_expected: The video launched and viewed in steps 2-4 displays in the CONTINUE WATCHING list.

title: Continue Watching: Verify launching a VOD and exiting playback before the end; 'Continue Watching' thumbnail displays on Home
custom_preconds:
No Items have been added to the CONTINUE WATCHING list

At Home Confirm CONTINUE WATCHING  thumbnail display default image (WWE logo)

1. Select any VOD, at Show Launch Select WATCH NOW
3. Video launches (preroll and bumpers play); let playback continue for at least 15 seconds
4. Back out of video
5. Confirm Show launch screen displays Progress bar representative of amount watched and that RESUME button replaces WATCH NOW
6. Note the show and progress
7. Go to HOME
custom_expected: Continue Watching Tile displays with thumbnail image from content just watched/bookmarked

title: Verify Show Launch page for bookmarked VOD displays a RESUME WATCHING button & a WATCH FROM BEGINNING button

2. Let play for >10 secs
3. Back out of video.
custom_expected: Show Launch page displays a RESUME WATCHING button and WATCH FROM BEGINNING button

title: Verify Resume Watching resumes as required
custom_steps:
1. While playing any VOD program, note time and back out of video.
2. From Show Launch, launch via Resume Watching.
3. Note time displayed when video begins playback.
4. Compare exit time and reentry time.
custom_expected: Program resumes at a point up to ten seconds in the past (with median of 5 second delay)

title: Verify Resume Watching resumes without any Pre-Roll/Advisory/Ads
custom_steps: 1. Launch any previously viewed program via Resume Watching
custom_expected: Confirm resuming playback of a bookmarked asset will bypass ads and bumpers (advisory slates)

title: Verify bookmarked VOD displays a progress bar that accurately reflects the % of VOD viewed in all expected locations
custom_steps:
Note playback position in Video Playhead and exit playback from Video Program. Confirm Progress bar showing expected % of playback in the following locations:

- Show Index Pages 
- Continue Watching Index Page (New)  
- Watchlist
-- Episode tile in list
--- Episode details page
-- Watchlist Series > Episode tile > details page
- Video Detail pages 

Note: Progress bar should not appear in Schedule (EPG) pages.
custom_expected: Progress bar showing expected % of playback in all expected locations.

title: Verify app allows only one Bookmark per Video Program
custom_preconds: Start at a Show Launch page of a program not yet viewed (no bookmark set)
custom_steps:
1. Activate PLAY button to launch video
2. Seek to 1/4 mark of progress bar, allow >10 sec. playback and note time point in program as seen in playhead
3. Back out of video
4. Verify correct progress bar positioning seen in Show Launch page 
5. Activate Resume Playback
6. Verify correct progress bar positioning seen in playhead 
7. Rewind >3 minutes allow >10 sec. playback and note time point in program as seen in playhead
8. Back out of video
9. Verify correct progress bar positioning seen in Show Launch page 
10. Activate Resume Playback
11. Verify correct progress bar positioning seen in playhead
custom_expected: In steps 4, 6, 9 and 11 Bookmark set should always be set from most recent view of content.

title: Verify Milestone View sets appropriate bookmark
custom_preconds: Start at Search Page - app must have confirmed "Add Milestone" functionality.
custom_steps:
1. Search for a Milestone
- Go to search.
- type in "cena vs rock" then press down to select the search bar and press X to search.
2. Select any of the singles matches (thoes are milestones).
3. From Milestone Launch page, activate Add To Watchlist
4. Activate Play Milestone note time in playhead & let video play for 10 + seconds
5. Jump to My Account > Continue Watching
6. Identify recently added Milestone's program and activate Resume Playback
7. Confirm time launched from is as expected from step 2
8. Seek >10+ mins and let play for >10sec, note time in playhead
9. Back out of video
10. Nav to Watchlist > Episodes
11. Identify recently added Milestone (same as added in step 2 and played back in step 6) & activate
12. Confirm time launched from is as expected from step 2
custom_expected: Bookmarking is overridden by Milestone Launch. In step 12, app should never playback from bookmark set in step 8.

title: Verify Bookmarks are consistent and accessible on all devices
custom_preconds:
Playstation and a different platform must be used in this test.

- PS on Show Launch of unseen program.
- Other device on any page other than Home.
- Both devices logged in to same account.
custom_steps:
1. Launch video.
2. Seek >5 mins and note time.
3. Exit via Back.
4. In under 5 seconds, use other device to nav to Home > Continue Watching > 1st time in list and launch Resume Playback
5. Confirm 2nd device plays back same program from step 1 and from time noted in step 2
6. While playback ensues, return to PlayStation and nav to Continue Watching, highlighting 1st item in list
7. Return to device 2, seek >5 mins and note time.
8. Exit via Back.
9. In under 5 seconds, use PS to activate 1st item in list and then launch Resume Playback
10. Confirm PS plays back same program from step 1 and from time noted in step 7
custom_expected: Bookmarks will be synched across devices fast enough to support switching use case (under 5 seconds between closing one and opening the other app).

title: Verify Unaired Program "Network Interstitials" (Not Yet Aired Message) is not added to Continue Watching when viewed
custom_steps:
1. Launch the app 
2. Go to Schedule > Access a program on the Schedule that has not yet premiered (NXT on Thursdays at 6pm PST debuts new episodes) 
3. Activate the show > Observe message "This video is not yet available for on-demand viewing" followed by a WWE promo > After playback ends, the app goes to the Playback screen with RESUME and FROM BEGINNING buttons onscreen 
4. Go back to the WWE HOME > Access Continue Watching and observe
custom_expected: The Network Interstitial tile should not populate this list.

title: Verify Watchlist is consistent and accessible on across devices (Episodes, Milestones and Series)
custom_preconds: Must have current app installed on PlayStation and an alternate platform/device. Test account should not have Watchlist items set.
custom_steps:
1. From Shows menu navigation to Show Launch (details) Page, add Episode and Series to Watchlist.
2. Nav to Search and search for a Milestone result.
3. Activate Milestone.
4. At Milestone Launch, add to Watchlist.
5. Nav to My Account > Watchlist
6. Confirm Series, Episodes & Milestones expected items have been added.
7. Quit app.
8. Launch app on alt device/platform (must be confirmed as Watchlist service enabled)
9. Nav to Watchlist and confirm expected items appear: Series, Episodes, Milestones added to watchlist in steps 1 & 4
10. Via activation of Episode and Milestone thumb launch in Episodes, remove all items from Series/Episodes Watchlists And confirm empty.
11. Repeat steps 1-9 substituting second device/platform for PlayStation and vice-versa.
custom_expected: Watchlist items should appear across devices, both addition and removal should reflect user actions. Episodes, Milestones and Series should all reflect addition/removal within PS app and across platforms.

title: Verify Watchlist order is consistent across devices (Episodes, Milestones and Series)
custom_preconds: PS and Web version should be set on same test account. Test account should not have Watchlist items set.
custom_steps:
1. Add several Episodes, Milestones and Series to Watchlist.
2. Nav to My Account > Watchlist
3. Confirm in both Series and Episodes (Milestones tracked here) that expected items have been added and appear in order of most recent first.
4. Record order in both Watchlists.
5. Quit app.
6. Launch app on web version.
7. Confirm in both Series and Episodes that expected items appear in order noted in step 4.
8. Manually reorder Episodes/Series items and record new orders.
9. Quit web version.
10. Launch PS app.
11. Nav to My Account > Watchlist and confirm order noted in step 8 appears in Series and Episodes.
custom_expected: Watchlist items should appear in same order across devices. PS "most recent" (default) ordering should carry over to other devices (web in this test). Manual ordering in web should be reflected in PS.

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted content from user’s Series Watchlists
custom_preconds: Test account should be set with parental controls OFF and Watchlist populated with at least one TV-14 or higher rated item in Series.
custom_steps:
1. Confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist items appear in Series LVLs 1 & 2 - record list.
2. Quit app.
3. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
4. Relaunch app.
5. Nav to Watchlist > Series and confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist items do not appear.
6. Quit app.
7. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
8. Relaunch app
9. Nav to Watchlist > Episodes and confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist items appear as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected:
Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from user’s Series Watchlists and disabling enabling parental controls will reveal the same content.

Note that some Series will have varying content ratings within (i.e. Legends' House) that will hide some and reveal others within LVL 2 of Episodes. In these cases, whole Series should not be hidden.

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted content from user’s Episodes Watchlists
custom_preconds: Test account should be set with parental controls OFF and Watchlist populated with at least one TV-14 or higher rated item in Episodes.
custom_steps:
1. Confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist items appear in Episodes - record list.
2. Quit app.
3. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
4. Relaunch app.
5. Nav to Watchlist > Episodes and confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist items do not appear.
6. Quit app.
7. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
8. Relaunch app.
9. Nav to Watchlist > Episodes and confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist items appear as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected: Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from user’s Episodes Watchlists and disabling enabling parental controls will reveal the same content.

title: Collection: Verify that selecting the Collection tile brings the user to the Collections list Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the WWE Network
AND we have accessed the Channel




access criteria:
Collections are strict ordered sets that may contain any Episodes any Milestones and/or combinations of each.
Individual Collections can be grouped into a list of multiple Collections.
A list of Collections are made available through various carousels interfaces and promotional displays across multiple platforms.
An individual Collection is represented by a unique ID and contains Assets ID of existing records that have their own meta data, dates, restrictions. 
Enabling Collections introduces a new editorial content type for WWE and enables them to produce Internet-ready content formatted for audiences who may choose to consume smaller Talent-curated video. 

ref: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/SFProduct/WWE+Editorial+Collections
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the Home Section
AND we select the Collection tile from the bottom carousel
custom_expected:
THEN the appropriate Collections page opens
AND the curated list of Collections will be displayed and selectable

> EX:
> sudo ipfw add 1 pipe 1 src-port 80
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 3000KByte/s
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 500KByte/s
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 75KByte/s
> sudo ipfw delete 1
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the bitrate adapt
AND the video playback will adjust accordingly based on the connectivity of the wireless ad hoc network

title: ***Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement

custom_steps:

title: PS4 Only: Rest Mode & Resume
custom_preconds: (from Sony Platform Requirement PS4: Rest Mode R4017 - Rest Mode & Resume)
custom_steps:
(1) On TestKit, set "Settings" > "★Debug Settings" > "Boot Parameters"
     > "Release Check Mode" to "Release Mode".

 (2) From "Settings" > "Power Save Settings" > "Set Functions Available in 
     Rest Mode", mark the "Keep Application Suspended" checkbox.

 (3) From the home screen, select the application and start it.

 (4) Within the application, press and hold the PS button. From the quick menu,
     select "Enter Rest Mode". Especially perform the check in sections where 
     the online mode/network feature is used.
     Note that it is also possible to transition once to the home screen and
     then to transition to the rest mode. Also test this case if the application
     changes behavior when it is running in the background.

 (5) Press the PS button and return from the rest mode.
     When using RTC/TSC, to detect a bug in the usage, leave the TestKit in
     the rest mode for a long time. Choose a time duration that is appropriate
     according to application specifications, for example, the time required
     to discard a network authentication ticket.
custom_expected:
- A crash or deadlock does not occur when returning from the rest mode and
    application advancement does not become impossible.
 - Advancing to certain modes such as, the online mode and use of features
    implemented on the application are possible without having to restart the
    application.
